                  Far from wiping out monarch butterflies, the GMO crop farmers in the upper midwest have been posting photos of hundreds of monarchs gathered on their farm property last September:
                  <a href="https://www.learner.org/cgi-bin/jnorth/jn-query-byday?1409942868" onclick="__gaTracker('send', 'event', 'outbound-comment', 'https://www.learner.org/cgi-bin/jnorth/jn-query-byday?1409942868', 'https://www.learner.org/cgi-bin/jnorth/jn-query-byday?1409942868');" rel="nofollow">

                <li class="comment odd alt depth-2" id="dsq-comment-154929">

                   <span id="dsq-author-user-154929">
                    Arthur Doucette
                   </span>
                  </cite>
                 </div>
                 <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-154929">
                  <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-154929">
                   <p>
                    Monarchs benefited from the way farmers used to grow corn which involved more tilling.
                    <br/>
                    Tilling doesnt kill Milkweed though.
                    <br/>
                    So it and corn got along nicely.
                    <br/>
                    Not doing as well with extensive use of glyphosate, but the Monarch boom because of the tilling is an artifact.
                    <br/>
                    The species is not in danger, at least from activities in North America.
                    <br/>
                    There remains plenty of milkweed, and now people are planting it just for the Monarchs.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    <a href="https://fbcdn-sphotos-d-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/15614_10204630645058626_6662060863492289547_n.jpg?oh=161eefca8c1109b4da027ee9928ae620&amp;oe=5556382D&amp;__gda__=1435469072_e49758251dbb076b07eb810ef75583b9" onclick="__gaTracker('send', 'event', 'outbound-comment', 'https://fbcdn-sphotos-d-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/15614_10204630645058626_6662060863492289547_n.jpg?oh=161eefca8c1109b4da027ee9928ae620&amp;oe=5556382D&amp;__gda__=1435469072_e49758251dbb076b07eb810ef75583b9', 'https://fbcdn-sphotos-d-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xpa1/v/t1.0-9/15614_10204630645058626_6662060863492289547_n.jpg?oh=161eefca8c1109b4da027ee9928ae620&amp;oe=5556382D&amp;__gda__=1435469072_e49758251dbb076b07eb810ef75583b9');" rel="nofollow">

              <li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="dsq-comment-153324">
               <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-153324">
                <cite id="dsq-cite-153324">
                 <span id="dsq-author-user-153324">
                  Susan Sauceda
                 </span>
                </cite>
               </div>
               <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-153324">
                <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-153324">
                 <p>
                  <a href="http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9595985" onclick="__gaTracker('send', 'event', 'outbound-comment', 'http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9595985', 'http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9595985');" rel="nofollow">
                   http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9595985
                  </a>
                  .  Here ya go, is the NIH good enough for you?  Since you are unable to use the internet.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
               <ul class="children">
                <li class="comment odd alt depth-2" id="dsq-comment-153374">
                 <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-153374">
                  <cite id="dsq-cite-153374">
                   <span id="dsq-author-user-153374">
                    Arthur Doucette
                   </span>
                  </cite>
                 </div>
                 <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-153374">
                  <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-153374">
                   <p>
                    Right, there is an association to PD and those who apply herbicides and pesticides.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    Which is why farmers are switching to GMO crops, since they reduce the amount of Insecticides used and reduce the toxicity of herbicides used.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    <a href="https://fbcdn-sphotos-e-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-prn1/t31.0-8/10926202_10204982520835010_3958032932716474598_o.jpg" onclick="__gaTracker('send', 'event', 'outbound-comment', 'https://fbcdn-sphotos-e-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-prn1/t31.0-8/10926202_10204982520835010_3958032932716474598_o.jpg', 'https://fbcdn-sphotos-e-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-prn1/t31.0-8/10926202_10204982520835010_3958032932716474598_o.jpg');" rel="nofollow">
                     https://fbcdn-sphotos-e-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-prn1/t31.0-8/10926202_10204982520835010_3958032932716474598_o.jpg
                    </a>
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    As to herbicides:
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    This chart summarizes herbicide use on soybeans in 1996, before HT crops were widely adopted, and in 2006, after HT crops were widely adopted.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    For the column headings,
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    Use = % of this pesticide compared to the total of all pesticides;
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    Rate = pounds of active ingredient applied per acre of soybeans;
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    Toxicity = chronic toxicity score (higher is safer);
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    Half life = number of days it takes for 1/2 of the herbicide active ingredient to degrade in the soil.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    EIQ (Environmental Impact Quotient, lower is safer)  EIQ is a numerical representation of the risks a pesticide poses for the environment, consumers, and farm workers. (The EIQ for 2,4-D is an average of the EIQs for 5 different formulations of the herbicide.)
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    By 2006, the majority of farmers had switched to glyphosate, the least toxic of the herbicides, with it making up 85% of herbicide use. So the total amount of herbicides is trending down and the total environmental impact due to herbicides has also decreased.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    <a href="http://www.agbioforum.org/v15n3/v15n3a01-fernandez-cornejo.htm" onclick="__gaTracker('send', 'event', 'outbound-comment', 'http://www.agbioforum.org/v15n3/v15n3a01-fernandez-cornejo.htm', 'http://www.agbioforum.org/v15n3/v15n3a01-fernandez-cornejo.htm');" rel="nofollow">
                     http://www.agbioforum.org/v15n3/v15n3a01-fernandez-cornejo.htm
                    </a>
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    <a href="http://i0.wp.com/www.biofortified.org/wp-content/uploads//2014/02/Screen-Shot-2014-02-17-at-22.49.26.png?resize=325%2C226" onclick="__gaTracker('send', 'event', 'outbound-comment', 'http://i0.wp.com/www.biofortified.org/wp-content/uploads//2014/02/Screen-Shot-2014-02-17-at-22.49.26.png?resize=325%2C226', 'http://i0.wp.com/www.biofortified.org/wp-content/uploads//2014/02/Screen-Shot-2014-02-17-at-22.49.26.png?resize=325%2C226');" rel="nofollow">
                     http://i0.wp.com/www.biofortified.org/wp-content/uploads//2014/02/Screen-Shot-2014-02-17-at-22.49.26.png?resize=325%2C226
                    </a>
                   </p>
                  </div>
                 </div>

                    <li class="comment odd alt depth-4" id="dsq-comment-154129">
                     <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-154129">
                      <cite id="dsq-cite-154129">
                       <span id="dsq-author-user-154129">
                        FarmersSon63
                       </span>
                      </cite>
                     </div>
                     <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-154129">
                      <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-154129">
                       <p>
                        Susan, you need to compare toxicity of GMO pesticides vs. Conventional Pesticides.
                        <br/>
                        Organophosphate insecticides are so toxic that a teaspoon full could kill you. These are used on conventional crops to kill insects.
                        <br/>
                        Bt proteins are used in GMO crops to kill insects. Bt proteins are over 1,000 times less toxic than organophosphate insecticides.
                        <br/>
                        Also compare herbicides.
                        <br/>
                        Atrazine is 50 times more toxic than glyphosate.
                        <br/>
                        Glyphosate usage would have to increase 50 times to equal the toxicity of atrazine, and it hasnt.
                       </p>
                      </div>
                     </div>

                      <li class="comment odd alt depth-5" id="dsq-comment-155095">

                        <cite id="dsq-cite-155095">

                       <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-155095">
                        <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-155095">
                         <p>
                          The threshold limit value (TLV) of a chemical substance is a level to which it is believed a worker can be exposed day after day for a working lifetime without adverse health effects.
                         </p>
                        </div>
                       </div>
                      </li>
                      <!-- #comment-## -->
                      <li class="comment even depth-5" id="dsq-comment-155123">
                       <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-155123">
                        <cite id="dsq-cite-155123">
                         <span id="dsq-author-user-155123">
                          Excuse My Ignorance
                         </span>
                        </cite>
                       </div>
                       <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-155123">
                        <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-155123">
                         <p>
                          and what are those levels with and without adverse health effects
                         </p>
                        </div>
                       </div>
                      </li>
                      <!-- #comment-## -->
                      <li class="comment odd alt depth-5" id="dsq-comment-155129">
                       <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-155129">
                        <cite id="dsq-cite-155129">
                         <span id="dsq-author-user-155129">
                          Arthur Doucette
                         </span>
                        </cite>
                       </div>
                       <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-155129">
                        <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-155129">
                         <p>
                          Depends on how you are exposed.
                         </p>
                         <p>
                          But lets take worst case, ingestion.
                         </p>
                         <p>
                          In reproductive toxicity studies performed in rats and rabbits, no adverse maternal or offspring effects were seen at doses below 175-293 mg/kg of body weight per day.
                         </p>
                         <p>
                          So lets take the lower number as being safe, or 175 mg/kg of body weight
                         </p>
                         <p>
                          Lets reduce that to just 17.5 mg/kg day for an additional safety margin compared to rabbits and rats. Note that the only health effects seen at the next highest test dose (350 mg/kg) were but slightly loose stools.
                         </p>
                         <p>
                          If you weigh 80 kg (176 lbs) then you could consume 1,400 mg of it per day and not even expect any slightly loose stools.
                         </p>
                        </div>
                       </div>
                      </li>
                      <!-- #comment-## -->

                <cite id="dsq-cite-154615">
                 <span id="dsq-author-user-154615">
                  Mary M.
                 </span>
                </cite>
               </div>
               <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-154615">

                 <p>
                  My family grows GMO crops Corn and soybean  in the heartland of Kansas. We have done our research/homework. We know that biotechnology is totally centered on finding solutions to our growing challenges as far as food production is concerned.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>

    onIdentify: fires when user is authenticated
    */

        firstScript.parentNode.insertBefore(script, firstScript);
    });

        disqus_config_custom.call(this);
    }
};

						e.preventDefault();
				startAtNum = 0;
				setTimeout(function(){

						animationSpeed: 300,
						controlNav: true,
						directionNav: true,
						pauseOnHover: true,
						namespace: "pps-",
						startAt: 0,
						before: function(){
							pauseVideosPopupPress(364253);
						},
						after: function(){
							refreshTopPosition(364253);
						},
						selector: "#slides-364253 &gt; li",
					});
				}
			}
			jQuery("#popuppress-364253").bPopup({
				closeClass: "pps-close-link-364253",
				easing: "swing",
				modalClose: true,
				modalColor: "#000000",
				opacity: 0.3,
				positionStyle: "absolute",
				position: ["auto","auto"],
				speed: 300,
				transition: "fadeIn",
				zIndex: 99999,
				amsl : 0,
				onOpen: function(){
					onOpenPopupPress(364253, "false");
					restoreVideosPopupPress(364253);
					disclaimerPopupPress(364253, "false", "same_page", "close_page", "true", "number_days",5);
				},
				onClose: function(){
					onClosePopupPress(364253);
					pauseVideosPopupPress(364253);
					//removeVideosPopupPress(364253);
				},
			});
			}, 0);});
						var cookieValue = jQuery.cookie("pps_cookie_364253");
						if(!jQuery.cookie("pps_cookie_364253") || cookieValue != "5_days" || jQuery(location).attr("href").indexOf("/wp-admin/") &gt;= 0){
							startAtNum = 0;

							setTimeout( function(){
			if(jQuery("#pps-slider-364253").length){
				if(typeof jQuery.fn.popupslider == "function") {
					jQuery("#pps-slider-364253").popupslider({
						slideshow: false,
						slideshowSpeed: 6000,
						animationSpeed: 300,
						controlNav: true,
						directionNav: true,
						pauseOnHover: true,
						namespace: "pps-",
						startAt: 0,
						before: function(){
							pauseVideosPopupPress(364253);
						},
						after: function(){
							refreshTopPosition(364253);
						},
						selector: "#slides-364253 &gt; li",
					});
				}
			}
			jQuery("#popuppress-364253").bPopup({
				closeClass: "pps-close-link-364253",
				easing: "swing",
				modalClose: true,
				modalColor: "#000000",
				opacity: 0.3,
				positionStyle: "absolute",
				position: ["auto","auto"],
				speed: 300,
				transition: "fadeIn",
				zIndex: 99999,
				amsl : 0,
				onOpen: function(){
					onOpenPopupPress(364253, "false");
					restoreVideosPopupPress(364253);
					disclaimerPopupPress(364253, "false", "same_page", "close_page", "true", "number_days",5);
				},
				onClose: function(){
					onClosePopupPress(364253);
					pauseVideosPopupPress(364253);
					//removeVideosPopupPress(364253);
				},
			});
			}, 100000);

							//Solo registramos cookies fuera de la administracin
							if(jQuery(location).attr("href").indexOf("/wp-admin/") &lt; 0){
								jQuery.cookie("pps_cookie_364253", "5_days", { expires: 5, path: "/"});
							}
						}
		});
  </script>
